abstract.p: Publicis SA acquires control of two more agencies in Asia (S)

block.p: Publicis S.A. in Paris is continuing its international expansion by moving into Asia, acquiring control of agencies in Singapore and the Philippines. Terms were not disclosed.

The acquisitions, announced yesterday, are part of ambitious growth plans that follow the termination of a worldwide cooperative agreement between Publicis and True North Communications. Publicis last year bought control of agencies in Brazil, Canada and Mexico.
Publicis S.A. in Paris is continuing its international expansion by moving into Asia, acquiring control of agencies in Singapore and the Philippines. Terms were not disclosed.

The acquisitions, announced yesterday, are part of ambitious growth plans that follow the termination of a worldwide cooperative agreement between Publicis and True North Communications. Publicis last year bought control of agencies in Brazil, Canada and Mexico.

In Singapore, Publicis acquired 60 percent of Eureka Advertising, which will be renamed Publicis-Eureka. The agency, which was formed in 1978, has 70 employees and billings estimated at $30 million. Ivan Chong, chairman and chief executive, will continue in those roles at Publicis-Eureka, which Publicis described as Singapore's top agency.

And in the Philippines, Publicis acquired Basic Advertising in Manila, which Publicis called the No. 2 agency in that market. Basic, which will be renamed Publicis-Basic, was formed in 1977 and has 240 employees and billings estimated at $70 million. Publicis-Basic will continue with Antonio Mercado as chairman and chief executive.
